alert.note: Alert for Lyon (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 22 at 1:39PM PDT until further notice by NWS Reno
info.description: ...Forecast flooding changed from Minor to Moderate severity for the following rivers in California...Nevada... West Walker River Near Little Walker and Coleville affecting Mono County. Walker River Near Mason at Snyder Lane affecting Lyon County. .Warm temperatures will continue snow melt in the Sierra. Heavy rain also fell over the weekend which has introduced additional water into the Walker River system. Combined with reservoir releases into the East Walker, the mainstem below the confluence will continue to rise through the week. Prolonged minor to moderate flooding is anticipated with additional rises likely with future warm periods. These may exceed this week`s crest. For the West Walker Above Topaz Lake...including Little Walker and Coleville...Moderate flooding is forecast. For the Mainstem Walker River...including Mason at Snyder Lane... Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FOR SNOWMELT AND UPSTREAM RESERVOIR RELEASES UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Walker River Near Mason at Snyder Lane. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 11.0 feet, Moderate flooding of lowlands, pasture and farmland adjacent to river throughout Mason Valley-Yerington area. Several rural and some secondary public roads flood. Yards and basements of lowest homes adjacent to the river in Mason and Yerington begin flooding. Preventative sandbagging is necessary. Possible damage to irrigation structures and levees Similar to June 24, 2017 peak, and slightly higher than July 1, 2011 peak. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:05 PM PDT Monday the stage was 10.5 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 1:05 PM PDT Monday was 10.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to 10.7 feet by noon Tuesday. It will then rise to 11.0 feet late Thursday morning and maintain this level into the weekend. - Flood stage is 9.8 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 11.1 feet on 07/04/1980. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Even 6 inches of fast-moving flood water can knock you off your feet and a depth of 2 feet will float your car. Never try to walk, swim, or drive through such swift water. If you come upon flood waters, stop, turn around and go another way. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.cnrfc.noaa.gov. The next statement will be issued Tuesday afternoon by 3 PM PDT.
